DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess macronutrient composition diet effect - lipid glucose metabolism - intrahepatic lipid - insulin sensitivity healthy lean subject subject high metabolic risk ( ie overweight offspring patient type 2 diabetes mellitus ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Macronutrients Hepatic Lipids , Plasma Triglycerides , Insulin Sensitivity
DOC.detailed_description: The study aim assess effect change total energy , sugar , lipid , protein intake intrahepatic lipid , plasma lipid , hepatic whole body insulin resistance - lean men woman family history diabetes - overweight men woman - lean men family history type 2 diabetes Subjects study 6-day period - isocaloric diet 100 % calorie requirement , 55 % carbohydrate , 15 % protein , 30 % fat ) - isocaloric diet supplement 3g/kg body weight/day fructose - hypercaloric high fat diet 130 % energy requirement , 55 % carbohydrate , 15 % protein , 60 % fat - hypercaloric high fat+protein diet 145 % energy requirement , 55 % carbohydrate , 30 % protein , 60 % fat Measurements perform 6 day diet include - intrahepatic intramyocellular lipid ( 1H-MRS ) - hepatic whole body insulin sensitivity ( hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp ) - body weight - plasma concentration hormones substrate - gene expression profile skeletal muscle ( vastus lateralis ) adipose tissue ( subcutaneous abdominal )
DOC.criteria: Males female Age 1840 Informed consent obtain Subgroup overweight ( body mass index [ BMI ] > 25 ) Subgroup family history type 2 diabetes mellitus Smokers Alcohol intake > 30g/day Drug abuse Diabetes mellitus Any concurrent medication Having pacemaker History orthopedic surgery History metal foreign body
